name: NETXP LINUX Unauthorized Changes to /etc/issue and /etc/issue.net
description:
/etc/issue and /etc/issue.net are files that are commonly used to display system information or a custom message to users when they log in or connect to a system.

The /etc/issue file typically contains information that is displayed on the system's console before a user logs in, providing details about the operating system or other relevant information. The /etc/issue.net file, on the other hand, is used in network logins and may display a message when users connect to services like SSH.
author: Szymon Gluch
query:
//any where auditd.log.key: "etcissue" and 
any where event.module: "auditd"
